article:
'K. J. Kapil Dev' is an Indian volleyball player from Kerala. He represented
India in many international competitions. Kapil also led the Indian National
Volleyball Team on a number of occasions, including the Rashid Memorial
International Volleyball Tournament held at Dubai in July 2006 and 15th Asian
Games at Doha. He was also a member of Indian team that
won the title in South Asian Games at Dhaka in 2010. At the national
level championships, Kapil represents Indian Railways.

Kapil employed with Indian railways, where he works in the Commercial Branch of
the Divisional office in Thiruvananthapuram. Kapil Dev hails from Varkala in
Thiruvananthapuram district. His wife Radhika is also a volleyball player in the
Indian Railway Team. Kapil Dev has been selected for the Arjuna Award
on 29 August 2010 for his contribution to Indian volleyball.
